name: Challenge gov
short_description:
A partnership between the public and the government to solve important
challenges.
long_description:
Challenge.gov is a technical platform and list of challenge and prize
competitions, all of which are run by more than 65 agencies across federal
government. These include technical, scientific, ideation, and creative
competitions where the U.S. government seeks innovative solutions from the
public, bringing the best ideas and talent together to solve mission-centric
problems. You will find hundreds of competitions that cover a wide range of
interests and require varying levels of skills and abilities in order to
participate. You can discover something of interest to you, sorting by type of
challenge and by the agency hosting the competition. They are listed in
chronological order, from most recent launched to older, closed competitions
going back to 2010. Challenge.gov is administered by the U.S. General Services
Administration (GSA) in partnership with agencies across government and the
White House Office of Science and Technology Policy.
